name: places/ChIJFwq6ABtawokRA3S5arbt9ew
formattedAddress: 250 Vesey St, New York, NY 10080, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 Vesey St, New York, NY 10080, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter in Hudson Eats offering dumplings, noodles & other Northern Chinese fare.

originalText.text: Good but not cheap. Dumplings are tasty and cold noodle salad is a must try. Nice setting in an upscale, high end food court with beautiful views of the North Cove Marina.

text.text: Good but not cheap. Dumplings are tasty and cold noodle salad is a must try. Nice setting in an upscale, high end food court with beautiful views of the North Cove Marina.

originalText.text:
Great place! I want to give this place five stars but $16 for 10 dumplings and a soda can be stressful for a college student's wallet. :/

Other than the price point (which is still very acceptable for the location and the food), this place is great. It's located within Brookfield Mall, within the food court. There aren't long lines, at least not while I was there, and the staff services guests quickly. I ordered the 10 Dumplings (Pan-Seared) and I was in love with them immediately! They serve Boylan sodas, which taste great for fountain soda. The dumplings come with a side of vinegar, and were steaming hot. They're flavorful and very savory compared to regular take out dumplings. ADVICE: Don't eat them right away, they tend to be pretty hot! There were no sanitary flags, utensils and napkins are on the side of the stall, and dumplings are served in a take out box.

If you're looking for good lunch, or are in the mood to try pretty damn good dumplings, this is definitely the place to go. Would not recommend the place if you're looking for somewhere cheap to go to though.

originalText.text: Nice quick place for Chinese noodles and other food. The wrap wasn't the best but the noodles were good!

text.text: Nice quick place for Chinese noodles and other food. The wrap wasn't the best but the noodles were good!

originalText.text:
The dumplings are pretty good and it's nice you have different cooking method options.
All the soups' broth and noodles are bland and tasteless, which is disappointing.

I haven't tried the rice bowls, but I can tell you the real star of this place is the "Sour and Very Spicy Chicken Noodles". That dish is really good! It says very spicy, but it's not very just normal spicy. That is the dish you would come here for!

text.text:

All the soups' broth and noodles are bland and tasteless, which is disappointing.

I haven't tried the rice bowls, but I can tell you the real star of this place is the "Sour and Very Spicy Chicken Noodles". That dish is really good! It says very spicy, but it's not very just normal spicy. That is the dish you would come here for!

originalText.text: A slightly different take on Chinese takeout that is incredibly delicious. The noodle bowls and soups are my go to (my two favorites being the spicy chicken and noodles or the dumpling soup), especially on a cold day, but the dumplings are also delicious. For the price you pay, you get a huge portion and they are pretty quick to turn around orders. If you're looking for something different than your typical General Tso's or chicken and broccoli, give this place a stop.
